title: Trump says Hamas must accept Gaza deal soon or face 'hell'
shortDescription: Trump gave Hamas a new deadline to accept his proposal to end the war in Gaza, and threatened a new level of violent reprisal if they refuse.

title: Trump administration freezes Chicago funding amid shutdown
shortDescription: The administration continues to target federal money for blue cities and states amid the government shutdown. Meanwhile, red Florida gets millions.

title: Shutdown enters Day 3 as Trump threatens firings: Updates
shortDescription: A vote in the Senate will determine if the government shutdown continues through the weekend. Hopes aren't high.

title: Did Trump say a shutdown falls on the president? Yes, before he ran
shortDescription: President Donald Trump previously said a shutdown is the responsibility of the president when Barack Obama was in the White House in 2011 and 2013.

title: The Trump administration wants control of agencies like the FCC
shortDescription: The Trump administration has been seeking greater power over independent agencies. But if the president controls the FCC, will speech be free?

title: Trump urges colleges to sign policy compact to boost access to funds
shortDescription: The Trump administration has asked nine universities to sign a compact committing their schools to adopt Trump's higher education agenda.

title: Trump tariffs hurting soybean farmers
shortDescription: President Trump has acknowledged tariffs are hurting soybean farmers, the country's largest agricultural export.

title: Education Department emails blame Democrats for shutdown
shortDescription: Outgoing messages from furloughed agency staffers say the government shutdown is Democrats' fault.

title: Pentagon tells Congress US is in 'armed conflict' with drug cartels
shortDescription: U.S. military forces 'remain postured' to carry out further strikes on drug cartels that have already killed 17 people, a Pentagon notice said.

title: Trump takes shutdown politics to new levels of pain, partisanship
shortDescription: President Donald Trumpâ€™s boundary-pushing second administration is on full display in his approach to the shutdown.

title: Can a sea of naked cyclists change Trump's mind on Portland?
shortDescription: In Portland, activists are planning a unique show of dissent: A naked bike ride to protest Trump's deployment of National Guard troops.

title: Poll: Americans blame Trump, GOP most for shutdown
shortDescription: In a new survey conducted the first day of the government shutdown, respondents said congressional Republicans and the president were most to blame.

title: Congress reporter on shutdown day 2
shortDescription: USA TODAY's Zach Schermele is on Capitol Hill on day two of the government shutdown as federal layoffs may begin soon, according to Russ Vought.

title: Amid shutdown, here is Trump's approval rating and what the polls show
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has been in office for more than 8 months, and after an initial drop, his approval rating has been steady over several months.
